changes.value: Restructure hero into a 2-column grid on desktop (60/40): left = H1 + 3-bullet value summary + primary/secondary CTA row; right = a static 'visibility panel' mock (activity feed + status chips). On mobile, stack with the mock below the CTAs and cap hero content to 1 short paragraph + 3 bullets.
changes.rationale: Improves above-the-fold clarity and scannability while immediately showing the 'hand it off without losing control' concept via a concrete visibility artifact instead of abstract claims.
risks: Mock panel may distract if too detailed; keep it visually quiet

changes.value: Place 2 CTAs in the hero in a single row on desktop and stacked on mobile with 12px gap: primary CTA first, secondary CTA second; add a short risk-reversal micro-block directly under CTAs (max 2 lines) and keep it within the first 600px height on desktop.
changes.rationale: Creates a clear conversion decision immediately, reduces friction, and keeps the action area visible without requiring scroll.
risks: If the hero is already dense, may require trimming other hero elements

changes.value: Add a mobile-only sticky CTA bar that appears after 40% scroll and hides on upward scroll; include 1 primary button and a secondary text link (no more than 2 actions). Keep height ≤ 56px and ensure 44px tap targets.
changes.rationale: Maintains a persistent conversion path for lead generation on small screens without forcing users to scroll back to the hero.
risks: Can feel intrusive; mitigate with delayed appearance and hide-on-scroll-up behavior

changes.value: Reorder sections to: Hero → Proof bar → Problem/Solution → How it Works → Visibility/Auditability (panel + log pattern) → Services/Suite → Pricing → FAQ → Footer. Keep total primary sections to 7–8 by merging any duplicate 'benefits' blocks into the Problem/Solution section.
changes.rationale: Creates a more logical narrative: establish credibility early, explain the model, then show how control/visibility works before asking users to evaluate services and pricing.
risks: Existing internal links/anchors may need updating

changes.value: Insert a proof bar directly under the hero (desktop: single row; mobile: 2-row wrap) with 3–5 items (e.g., client logos, certifications, measurable counters). Constrain height to ~72px and use monochrome marks to avoid visual noise.
changes.rationale: Adds immediate trust signals and reduces skepticism early in the funnel without adding reading load.
risks: If proof assets are weak, it can backfire; omit empty placeholders

changes.value: Convert Problem/Solution into a before/after two-column layout on desktop (50/50) and a stacked layout on mobile; limit each side to 3 bullets and 1 short paragraph. Add a small 'what you see / what we do' split to reinforce responsibility + visibility.
changes.rationale: Reduces cognitive load by making the transformation scannable and directly ties outcomes to observability rather than vague benefit lists.
risks: Requires consolidating overlapping content from other sections

changes.value: Present How It Works as a 3-step horizontal stepper on desktop and vertical stepper on mobile; each step uses a numbered badge, 2 bullets max, and an optional inline artifact preview (e.g., status indicator). Keep step cards equal height and use 24px internal padding.
changes.rationale: Clarifies the operating model quickly and prevents long paragraphs from burying the process.
risks: If there are more than 3 steps, some nuance may be lost; use an expandable 'details' pattern if needed

changes.value: Add an 'Audit log' pattern section with a compact activity feed component (8–10 rows) showing timestamped actions and approvals; include filters (All/This week) and a 'download/export' affordance. Place it before Services/Suite and keep it within a 2-column layout with explanatory bullets.
changes.rationale: Strengthens trust by demonstrating auditability and control tangibly, aligning with the promise of handing off work without losing visibility.
risks: If presented as fully functional UI, users may expect product features; label as example artifact

changes.value: Adopt a restrained type scale with clear hierarchy and capped measure: H1 48px/1.1 (mobile 34px/1.15), H2 32px/1.2 (mobile 26px), H3 22px/1.25, body 16–18px/1.6, small 13–14px/1.5. Set max text width to 65ch for body paragraphs and 42ch for hero lead text; use 600 weight for headings and 400–450 for body.
changes.rationale: A tighter, predictable scale and controlled line length increases calm readability and premium restraint while improving scan speed for small business owners.
risks: If existing content is very long, limiting to 65ch may increase page height and require more section tightening

changes.value: Standardize vertical spacing rhythm using an 8px base: between major sections 96px desktop / 64px mobile; within sections use 32px between heading and body, 24px between subsections, and 16px between stacked elements (e.g., bullets/CTAs). Use a consistent 12-col grid with 24px gutters (desktop) and 16px (mobile), and keep primary content blocks to 2-column layouts only at ≥1024px.
changes.rationale: Consistent spacing and grid rules reduce perceived noise, making the experience feel operational and confident rather than busy.
risks: May require reworking a few sections that currently rely on ad-hoc spacing to look balanced

changes.value: Define a 3-level button hierarchy with explicit states: Primary = solid fill, 44px min height, 16px horizontal padding, radius 12px; Secondary = outline 1.5px; Tertiary = text button. Add focus ring 2px (offset 2px) and hover/pressed transitions 120–160ms; disabled uses 40% opacity with no shadow. Ensure all buttons meet ≥4.5:1 contrast and provide 44px tap targets on mobile (including in sticky CTA bar).
changes.rationale: Clear hierarchy and predictable states communicate safety-by-default and reduce interaction uncertainty, especially on conversion-critical CTAs.
risks: If brand colors are low-contrast, primary/outline treatments may need token adjustments to pass WCAG

changes.value: Move to a premium, low-noise card spec: background = neutral-0, border 1px neutral-200, radius 16px, shadow only on hover (e.g., 0 8px 24px rgba(0,0,0,0.08)); default state uses no shadow. Use 24px internal padding (mobile 20px) and enforce density rules: max 2 lines for titles, max 3 bullets, and 12–16px spacing between internal rows. Prefer dividers (1px) over nested boxes inside cards.
changes.rationale: Subtle borders and restrained elevation feel calm and premium while keeping information operational and scannable.
risks: If the page background is also very light, low-shadow cards may blend; may require a soft background treatment to maintain separation

changes.value: Introduce proof/status chips with consistent sizing and semantics: 28–32px height, 12px horizontal padding, radius 999px, 1px border, and optional leading icon (14–16px). Use 3 semantic variants (Success/Neutral/Warning) mapped to tokens; keep chip text at 13–14px and limit chip rows to 2 lines on mobile with 8px gap. Use chips for 'proof bar' counters and for audit/status indicators in the visibility panel.
changes.rationale: Chips provide compact, calm proof signals and operational status cues without adding heavy visual components or long text blocks.
risks: Overuse of chips can create visual clutter; enforce limits per section (e.g., 3–5 in proof bar)

changes.value: Define an audit-log preview pattern as a compact feed: 8–10 rows, each row 44px min height with 12px vertical padding; columns for timestamp (monospace 13px), action (body 14–16px), and status chip; use subtle row separators (1px neutral-200) and a left accent rail (2px) only for critical events. Include a top row with 2 filter pills and an 'export' icon button; keep the whole component within a card and cap height to ~420px with internal scroll.
changes.rationale: A consistent log visual language makes auditing feel real and safe-by-default while staying quiet and premium rather than dashboard-heavy.
risks: If the log looks too product-like, users may assume a SaaS; ensure it reads as an example artifact via surrounding layout, not copy

changes.value: Standardize proof presentation into 2 patterns: (1) Proof bar under hero with monochrome logos sized to 24px height and a max row height of 72px; (2) Proof chips/counters with consistent typography (number 18px/600, label 13px/400) and 16px spacing. Use grayscale by default; allow a single accent color only for verified/secure markers.
changes.rationale: Restrained proof styling increases credibility without feeling salesy, reinforcing confident, operational trust signals early.
risks: If logos are low-quality or inconsistent, monochrome treatment may reduce recognizability; may require asset cleanup

changes.value: Shift to a calm neutral ramp optimized for readability: define neutral-0/50/100/200/600/900 with body text on neutral-900 and borders at neutral-200; use background sections alternating neutral-0 and neutral-50 to separate content without heavy dividers. Ensure all text/background pairs meet WCAG AA (≥4.5:1) and use neutral-600 for secondary text only at ≥16px.
changes.rationale: A disciplined neutral system is the foundation for a premium, safe-by-default feel and prevents accidental low-contrast UI.
risks: Existing brand colors may clash with a cooler/warmer neutral ramp; may require small adjustments to primary/accent tokens

issues.description: Hero visibility panel mock may confuse users about product vs service offering
issues.rationale: Static mock UI elements can mislead visitors into thinking they're viewing a SaaS product rather than consulting services

issues.description: Audit log pattern risks creating product expectations for service-based business
issues.rationale: Interactive-looking audit logs may confuse small business owners about deliverable format and create false expectations

issues.description: Sticky CTA appears too early at 40% scroll, may interrupt initial content consumption
issues.rationale: Small business owners need time to understand service value before being pushed toward conversion actions

issues.description: Hero 2-column layout may push CTAs below fold on smaller desktop screens
issues.rationale: 600px height constraint with dense hero content risks burying primary conversion action on 1366x768 screens

issues.description: Problem/Solution 50/50 layout wastes horizontal space and creates scanning friction
issues.rationale: Even columns force artificial content parity and make comparison harder than asymmetric problem-heavy layout

issues.description: Proof bar placement immediately after hero may interrupt narrative flow
issues.rationale: Trust signals work better after establishing problem relevance rather than front-loading credibility

issues.description: Type scale H1 48px may be too large for consulting services targeting small business
issues.rationale: Oversized headings can feel corporate/intimidating to small business owners who prefer approachable messaging

issues.description: 96px section spacing on desktop creates excessive white space for lead generation pages
issues.rationale: Large gaps increase scroll fatigue and may reduce conversion by spreading content too thin

issues.description: Card hover shadows add unnecessary interaction complexity for content presentation
issues.rationale: Hover effects on non-interactive content cards create false affordances and visual distraction

issues.description: Chip component introduction adds visual complexity without clear conversion benefit
issues.rationale: Multiple chip variants may create busy interface that distracts from primary lead generation goals

suggestedFixes.fix: Replace static UI mock with illustrated concept diagram showing handoff workflow with simple icons and arrows, max 3 steps
suggestedFixes.rationale: Removes product confusion while maintaining visual explanation of service delivery model

suggestedFixes.fix: Convert to sample deliverable preview showing report format, timeline, and approval checkpoints instead of live UI
suggestedFixes.rationale: Clarifies service deliverable format without creating software product expectations

suggestedFixes.fix: Delay sticky CTA appearance until 60% scroll and reduce to single primary action with 48px height
suggestedFixes.rationale: Gives users more content consumption time while maintaining mobile conversion path

suggestedFixes.fix: Reduce hero content density by limiting to H1 + 2 bullets + CTA row, ensure 480px max height on desktop
suggestedFixes.rationale: Guarantees above-fold CTA visibility on common screen sizes while maintaining key messaging

suggestedFixes.fix: Use 70/30 asymmetric layout with problem-focused left column and solution summary right, stack on mobile
suggestedFixes.rationale: Emphasizes pain points that drive conversion while providing balanced solution preview

suggestedFixes.fix: Move proof bar to after Problem/Solution section with 4 items max, 56px height, subtle background tint
suggestedFixes.rationale: Positions trust signals after establishing relevance, reduces visual weight in hero area

suggestedFixes.fix: Reduce H1 to 36px desktop/28px mobile with 1.2 line height, maintain hierarchy with H2 at 28px/22px
suggestedFixes.rationale: More approachable scale for small business audience while preserving clear information hierarchy

suggestedFixes.fix: Reduce section spacing to 72px desktop/48px mobile, maintain 32px heading-to-body and 24px subsection gaps
suggestedFixes.rationale: Tighter spacing improves scroll efficiency for lead generation without sacrificing readability

suggestedFixes.fix: Remove hover shadows, use consistent 1px border with 12px radius, 20px padding, focus on content density
suggestedFixes.rationale: Eliminates false affordances while maintaining clean content presentation and faster scanning

suggestedFixes.fix: Limit chips to proof counters only, single neutral variant, 24px height, use sparingly max 3 per section
suggestedFixes.rationale: Reduces visual complexity while maintaining compact proof presentation for key metrics
